---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->
- [x] depends on: #6768 
- [x] depends on: #6840
- [x]  depends on: #7078

maintainer merge

Thanks!

maintainer merge
I wonder if there is some other way than chaning `(x + 1) !` to 'x.succ * x` to satisfy the simpNF linter..
Does `@[nolint simpNF]` work? I'd say [Nat.factorial_succ](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Nat/Factorial/Basic.html#Nat.factorial_succ) shouldn't be a simp lemma ...

yes, that works. 
I will try what breaks if Nat.factorial_succ isn't a simp lemma...
https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/6840 seems like nothing breaks

Even after #6840, we still need the `nolint`, since `factorial` still simplifies, because of https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/f91160c3b897ef9698cd3706d2330c3b59fdb3e8/Mathlib/Data/Nat/Factorial/Basic.lean#L30

I considered removing the `simp` from the factorial here: #7078

However, it having the `simp` for the factorial seem to be useful in some cases.
What do you think, @alreadydone?
I left a comment on #7078. I would prefer to make this PR (#6806) depend on that one (#7078).
added dependency. Will make the needed changes one #7078 is resolved
done

```suggestion
-- `(x + 1)!` is simplified to `(x + 1) * x!`
```

```suggestion
theorem prod_Ico_factorial_eq_superFactorial : ∀ n : ℕ, (∏ x in Ico 1 (n + 1), x !) = sf n
```
I think the import should rather go the other direction. super factorials are pretty specialized, so they should import this generic file, and not the other way round.
done

```suggestion
theorem prod_Icc_factorial : ∀ n : ℕ, (∏ x in Icc 1 n, x !) = sf n
```
I'll fix the proof accordingly
done.
done.

```suggestion
import Mathlib.Algebra.BigOperators.Intervals
import Mathlib.Data.Nat.Factorial.Basic
```

```suggestion
theorem prod_range_factorial_succ : ∀ n : ℕ, ∏ x in range n, (x + 1)! = sf n
```

```suggestion
theorem prod_Icc_factorial : ∀ n : ℕ, ∏ x in Icc 1 n, x! = sf n
```

Ah, that's annoying 😦 
```suggestion
theorem prod_Icc_factorial : ∀ n : ℕ, ∏ x in Icc 1 n, x ! = sf n
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: super factorial written as product
